attributes.action: Illegal purchase of the Parthenon Marbles
attributes.additional_details: As fraud negates all statutory provisions or court regulations regarding time limitations there is a Prima Facie case that the British Museum in London is housing property stolen from Greece at a time when that country was under illegal foreign occupation. This stolen property which includes the Parthenon frieze was bought by Parliament for the nation from Thomas Bruce 7th Earl of Elgin for £35,000.00 in 1816. I am petitioning for an apology by the Prime Minister David Cameron to Greece for the actions of the then Parliament and the return of the Parthenon Marbles to Greece.
